intro: Amsinckia hansenii, commonly known as the Hansen's fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and hairy leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Amsinckia hansenii is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
